snippet: A man convicted of killing nine people, including six monks, during a robbery at a Buddhist temple west of Phoenix in 1991 was sentenced on Friday to 249 years in prison, ending one of the most notorious criminal cases in Arizona over the past 25...
abstract: Johnathan A Doody, convicted of killing nine people, including six monks, while robbing a Buddhist temple west of Phoenix in 1991 is sentenced to 249 years in prison; sentencing ends one of the most notorious criminal cases in Arizona over the past 25 years.
lead_paragraph: A man convicted of killing nine people, including six monks, during a robbery at a Buddhist temple west of Phoenix in 1991 was sentenced on Friday to 249 years in prison, ending one of the most notorious criminal cases in Arizona over the past 25 years.

headline.main: Arizona: Man Convicted of ’91 Killings at Buddhist Temple Gets 249 Years
headline.print_headline: Arizona: Man Guilty of ’91 Killings at Buddhist Temple Gets 249 Years
